title: (x) Turner Prize 08 - 09 Logo, Soft Rounded font - Tate Typeface, custom by Miles Newlyn {Jan}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110117091440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Turner_5338.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110117091440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Turner-Logo_5596.jpg)

I'm searching for the font used in the 'Turner Prize' Logo,  
at first I thought it kind of looked like the (wonderful) [Estilo](http://web.archive.org/web/20110117091440/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=Estilo&x=0&y=0&sample_text=TURNER%20PRIZE%20%2008%20%2F%20o8&update=0), as it's soft and Round and has a Swashed 'R' which in this case is done custom (or at least I think so,...) and after searching it resembles [the Ulissa](http://web.archive.org/web/20110117091440/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/ulissa_rounded_vp/?&sample_text=TURNER%20PRIZE%20%2008%20%2F%20o8&update=0)  
Maybe someone does know what 'is' used in this case?  
Thanks, A+
author: Allison Dh

comments.content: I think thatâ€™s custom face by Wolff-Olins.
I'd like to know more about that shirt.
